Params[3]: The remaining cleanup work progressed smoothly. Thanks to the coordinated efforts of all teams, the remnants of Hetero-Creatures on the west side were soon wiped out completely.
You reported the casualties and loss of equipment to Babylonia and were told the shuttle had already departed.

Liv stayed in the west to perform emergency treatment on the wounded soldiers. Lee and Lucia went in other directions to continue searching for survivors. Meanwhile, you are staying in the command center to help the seriously wounded Constructs stabilize their M.I.N.D.
Thanks... I feel much better now.
Captain? She was heading that way.
The Purifying Force soldier points at the breakwater.
You find Bianca by the seaside.

Along with the clearing battle smoke, The heavy clouds hanging overhead are gradually receding, as if they are declaring the end of the battle. The setting sun shines through the clouds, leaving a gentle hue of colors in the distant sky above the sea.
She sits on the edge of the breakwater, gazing at the distant sky absentmindedly. You walk next to her to look at the vast sea together.
Commandant.
Yeah. It's all over.
She looks back at you and nods.
I guess we will witness many more losses and farewells like this one in the future.
She whispers softly in a complicated tone, but there is no confusion in it.

Params[2]: I think so. But we will carry on with their will.

Params[3]: ...You're absolutely right, Commandant.
The blond female stands in the wind, reminding you of the Construct pulling her bow against the giant Heterozygote long ago.
Veritas and Stigmata look so different.

Params[2]: You found her. But have you also found yourself?

Params[3]: Bianca looks a little surprised initially, but soon understands the meaning behind the inquiry. She nods, raising her hand to gently tuck a strand of hair that dances in the sea breeze. The earrings that once belonged to Chiko are glimmering at her fingertips.

Params[2]: You look a lot more determined.

Params[3]: ...I am.
Bianca makes the first pure, genuine smile that you have seen ever since you started doing missions together.
You reply with another smile. Both of you just sit side by side, quietly watching the sea getting peaceful again in the sunset.
A few seagulls glide past, screeching in the wind. Moments later, you hear a few calls from afar. When you look over, you notice some Purifying Force members waving in your direction.
At the same time, the terminal receives a signal that the shuttle is about to arrive.
Alright.
Bianca turns back for one last time, holding her sword horizontally in front of her chest. She closes her eyes facing the direction where the Hetero-Humanoid disappeared.
...Is she praying? No, it looks more like a silent farewell or a devout oath.
The Phantom Tracer on Bianca's waist makes a brief hum as if it has sensed some sort of connection. A fragment-like object is flickering in the center of the lamp.
It fell off her and was absorbed by the Phantom Tracer.
I have a feeling that this is very important... After returning to Babylonia, I will submit it along with the mission report.
Let the Science Council analyze it.
E-02 'Babylonia', Science Council.
Frame adjustment completed. All parameters normal.
Bianca walks out of the training room. She has changed back to the Veritas frame after coming back to Babylonia.

Params[2]: Have you fixed the unstable M.I.N.D. of this frame?

Params[3]: It's all good now.
After rounds of adjustments and upgrades, Veritas can definitely replace the damaged Zero.

As for Stigmata... Its abilities have already been fully demonstrated in battle. I let Bianca change out of it because the Punishing Virus information inside the frame has yet to be completely neutralized. Using it will make her M.I.N.D. more unstable.
A thorough tuning is necessary before it can be used again.
As for the Phantom Tracer Bianca brought back...
Asimov taps on the light screen. A core fragment appears in the center. Looks like it was formed from Punishing Virus Heteromers.

Params[2]: Does it have anything to do with Chiko?
Params[4]: Does it have anything to do with Ascendants?

Params[3]: No. The fragment appears to be merely a vessel for transmitting information. What really matters is the message it carries.
It almost feels like someone was purposely using the fact that the Punishing Virus could carry information... Actually, there's more than that. I must have overlooked something more important.
The encryption method is beyond my knowledge, at least for now.
Asimov frowns. He curls his index finger to rub his temple.

Params[2]: If it's a piece of information... Can you track its source?

Params[3]: I didn't have time to find out its true origin. The first piece of deciphered information looks like a "message."
Asimov raises his hand, displaying the information to the screen. They seem like just a few pages of cryptic codes to you.
Only one obscure message was deciphered from the codes.

Params[2]: This is a gift... in the name of the future.

Params[3]: I don't know what it really means.
The message does not quite make sense, but that familiar gray-haired girl suddenly appears in your mind. She waves at you with a bright smile, then walks away into the dazzling light.

Params[2]: (Speaking of it... You haven't seen her for a long time.)

Params[3]: Anyway, there are still a lot of unsolved mysteries regarding this fragment. I will continue analyzing it.
Apart from the fragment, the production of Omega Weapons also needs to be prioritized. We have almost used up all the available inventory in this battle.
But we won.
Hassen's brow seems to have relaxed a bit. He points to the casualty rate displayed on the screen. The final number is even lower than Gestalt's estimate.
Like you said, the people who bring us hope are our most important resources.
The battle outcome is exactly like what we estimated. Most of the participants have survived. There is no better victory than this.
The only regret is we could not retrieve Lithos' frame.
I was already getting close to where Lithos sank, but a large number of Hetero-Creatures suddenly appeared from the sea. When we cleared them up, his frame had already disappeared.
Thinking back now, the Hetero-Creatures were probably...

Params[2]: They purposely showed up to transfer Lithos' frame away before you got ahold of it.

Params[3]: Correct. The only party that could do this was...
Only Ascendants or agents have the power to control such a vast number of Hetero-Creatures.
That enigmatic figure has once again been hiding behind multiple mysteries, manipulating the situation and reaping the outcomes they desired.
Everybody knows death is not the end for that Ascendant who fell into the sea.
I could only find Lithos' hairpin. I've brought it back.
It could be just your illusion, but Asimov seemed a little odd when she mentioned "hairpin."
That hairpin? It passed the sterilization process not long ago and was delivered. I left it in that box over there...
Asimov looks back at the desk behind. He suddenly stops.
You look in the same direction. There is a box on his desk, but it has been opened by someone. There is nothing inside.
It was right here...

Params[2]: Did anyone else come to this place other than us?

Params[3]: Apart from you, there was only Rosa, who had been staying in the lab... Wait a sec...
Rosa?
Asimov raises his voice, calling out her name. But the timid, purple-haired girl is not coming out of a pile of documents as she usually did.
The box is carefully opened and put aside. Asimov looks at it and recalls the coincidental encounter between Rosa and Noan not long ago.
...He did not want to bring up the "unimportant" past, but he had forgotten that Rosa had always wanted to know the truth behind some things.
He sighs to himself.
Whew...
Noan walks out of the lab's door and lets out a deep breath in the empty corridor.
The tests have placed a substantial burden on him, but he has been making maximum efforts to cooperate.
Before leaving, he notices a purple braid sticking out from a corner, swaying along with its owner's movements.
Whoever that is, they seem to be hesitating.
He tries to walk away to a more crowded place. Not surprisingly, he hears rushed footsteps behind.
One moment please!
T-there's something I'd like to ask you...
...Rosa?
It's me. Sorry to disturb you...
No problem at all. What can I do for you?
Noan turns back and looks at the little girl.
Do you still remember last time...?
She mentioned how Noan mistook herself for Lithos when he first came to the Science Council.
It was my bad... Sorry.
No... Actually, I just wanted to ask...
Stuttering, the girl opens her palm to show Noan the hairpin that she has been closely holding against her chest.
Do you know anything about this...?
This is...
A shiver runs through Noan's heart as he cannot be more familiar with the object in her hand. It is Lithos' hairpin.
It can only mean that...
So... don't forget to introduce yourself again the next time you see me... I'm afraid I won't remember you.
—Lithos is dead.
Noan gazes at Rosa in silence. Seeing his expression, Rosa anxiously raises her voice.
All I know is that there is an Ascendant named Lithos. Everything about him is classified... Asimov didn't want to tell me anything...
Not even his look...? But you did say this name when you saw me on that day...
Noan realizes what she is trying to ask. His first response is to turn her down.
Sorry, but I can't tell you anything. I signed the confidentiality agreement.
But...
Large tears roll down the girl's cheeks. She begins to sob, mumbling words to beg him.
P-please... You're the only one I can ask...
W-wait! Don't cry!
Realizing Noan is a little shaken, Rosa begins to cry even louder.
(Weeping)
Um...
Slightly troubled, Noan scratches his head. He then gently crouches down in front of the sobbing girl.
Rosa... I can't tell you more...
He takes out a sketchbook and a pen from his backpack and begins to draw the look of Lithos.
...But I can draw him for you. Will this work?
...Yeah. Thank you...
She wipes away the tears blurring her vision. Her eyes widen as she watches Lithos' face gradually appearing on the pale paper.
I didn't add colors... But Lithos' hair and eyes are all purple, very similar to yours.
He pulls the page off the sketchbook and passes it to Rosa.
May I ask why this matters so much to you?
I have another hairpin that looks exactly like this one at home... But it is a lot older. I don't know whether it is part of Mother's memory, or just one of the "materials" she brought back.
She shakes her head, trying to cast away the mixed memories. She carefully holds the sketch and the hairpin in her palms.
Can I take this sketch back...? I won't let anyone find it...
Of course.
Thank you. Please don't tell others what I asked.
Sure. Similarly, please don't tell others what I told you.
Noan puts a finger to his mouth. Rosa wipes off the tears on her chin, then nods with a smile too.
It's a deal. Nobody tells anyone anything.
Yeah. It's our promise.
It's our secret.
Star of Life, Commandant's ward.
Vanessa sits silently on the hospital bed, gently touching the horrifying scar on her left eye.
She picks up the damaged small terminal and opens an image folder hidden with a commandant's highest permission level.
There are only a few images in the folder. Her hand pauses on the latest one.
Hah, secret...
She smiles in a self-mocking way, pulling the scar and bringing a faint, itchy pain.
—Before returning to Babylonia.
Alright, I've got to go.
...Wait. There is one last thing.
Vanessa waves her recording terminal.
Gray Raven had a photo like this. Let's take one too for our final time together.
Nobody expects her to say such words on a battlefield full of potential threats of Hetero-Creature.
...A photo?
Fine then. This is the last time anyway.

Teasell cannot understand why his former commandant wants to take a photo of a traitor, but he no longer has any desire to find out the reasons behind Vanessa's changes. He has already made up his mind to leave them.
Bambinata, stand next to Teasell.
Bambinata nods in obedience. She follows Vanessa's instruction to stand next to Teasell, striking a "photo-taking" pose.
Teasell just turns sideways and crosses his arms. He keeps a poker face, but has not left.
Vanessa raises her terminal to put both of them in the viewfinder. Seeing the terminal's screen, she makes another breezy smile, but never presses the shutter.
What is she waiting for? Teasell looks over in confusion. Bambinata just keeps her hand up helplessly, maintaining the pose.
Vanessa ignores Teasell's questioning look. She just looks into the distance.
At the very end of her vision, she can barely see a familiar pink figure on the distant coastline.
Completely unaware of Vanessa's gaze, Liv rushes directly to the wounded Constructs. Vanessa cannot see her face, but she can easily imagine her expression.
It must be that same firm, determined look that once made her laugh. Just like when she cut off her long hair in the factory ruins, or when she said "I won't flee" in the ambulance.

The Gray Raven in that ambulance reminded Vanessa of Teasell, who had gone missing. She has seen many "dolls" who died or fled from her hands, but never thought that one of them would come back and save her life.
Perhaps it is already too late, but something has changed indeed.
Just when Liv enters the viewfinder, Vanessa presses the shutter, capturing this scene.
—Bambinata is still submissive, but Teasell no longer obeys orders. Vanessa still does not want to be in the photo. With Liv in the distance, the once glorious Egret has their first and last photo.
They are going to part ways.
Alright. It's over.
Teasell looks away and walks in the opposite direction. He could not hold it when walking past Vanessa.
We will be enemies the next time we meet.
...Hah, I don't want to see a traitor again. Besides, once I throw away a "doll," it is no different from dead to me.
Vanessa feels her body is getting increasingly heavier. She no longer looks at Teasell, but raises her head and walks toward the temporary command center.
Bambinata comes to Vanessa and helps her walk. She looks back at Teasell for one last time.
Just pray we will never meet again.
Someone is knocking on the door. Vanessa turns off the terminal's screen and puts it face down on the blanket.
A doctor of Star of Life walks in with a report in his hand, followed by Celica, who is holding a fruit basket.
The results are out. Your recovery is progressing well.
But the wound on your face may take some time to heal.
As for your left eye... Unfortunately, it was wounded too badly and didn't receive timely treatment. Its vision is completely lost and cannot be recovered.
...But considering your situation at that time, this is already the best outcome.
I suggest you have the eyeball removed as soon as possible to avoid sympathetic ophthalmia. Once it's out, you can consider installing a prosthetic one.
Celica thought Vanessa would blow up for this, but she just waves her hand as if she does not care at all.
Whatever.
The scar and prosthetic eye can serve as evidence, proving that I saved so many lives, as well as that loser, 【kuroname】.
She casually runs her fingers through the hair on the side, giving her usual sarcastic smile.
Hope that Chief can regret lying down for 3 months and doing nothing after seeing my face.
If you say so... 【kuroname】 just happens to be in Star of Life helping Liv for her rehab. Would you like me to call him?
Vanessa just sneers disdainfully.
If that Chief insists to apologize and thank me, I don't mind accepting it.
But I hope that Chief can show some sincerity and stand for at least an hour before coming in.
That's what she said.
Commandant...
Vanessa did save us in the evacuation of City 043.
Without her and Bambinata to cover us, maybe everybody left in the conservation area would...

The medic Construct mentioned the long-lost Vanessa showing up at the temporary command center, seriously wounded. She was in a coma for quite some time due to infection after being sent back to Star of Life.

When Vanessa appeared, she never talked about her injuries or what happened in the past few months. She just provided tactical assistance to the surrounded soldiers with Bambinata until the battle ended.
After joining the main force, she was sent to Star of Life. She was once in a coma due to serious infection.
Liv and Lucia had also told you the stories in City 043 long ago.

Params[2]: I'll be there right away once you finish your treatments.
I'll wait for another half an hour.

Params[3]: Okay.
Liv hesitates a little and shakes her head.
You go first, Commandant. I will visit her alone later.
I heard Teasell defected... If she sees us together, I'm worried that she may...
Okay, I'll just wait here, then I'll take you to her.
Half an hour has passed after all the treatments were completed.
You follow Celica to Vanessa's ward.
Who's that?
You hear Vanessa's voice. Unlike the mean, sarcastic impression she usually leaves, this time her hoarse voice sounds weak and lonely.
What?!
The voice immediately changes to another tone, as if the loneliness was just your illusion.

Params[2]: It's me. I just want to check on you.
Params[4]: I'd like to apologize and thank you.

Params[3]: Wait! I can't believe you are so rude.
I said, show some sincerity and stand for at least an hour before coming in.
Not only you didn't stand long enough, you were also a full 34 minutes late.
Is that how you treat someone who saved your life, Gray Raven Commandant?
Wait...
Celica stops you. She moves closer and whispers.
Commandant Vanessa suffered serious injuries. She lost her left eye... In fact, she is close to being disfigured.
Celica has a sympathetic look on her face. She has met Vanessa a few times before this.
She must be feeling terrible. So...

Params[2]: I heard her injuries were bad.

Params[3]: Yes... Because she wasn't treated in time... She is almost disfigured.
You recall every encounter with Vanessa. She was always glamorous, beautiful, keeping her elegance even during surface missions.
For someone with so much pride...
Another half an hour has passed.
You knock on the door again. This time, she has not rejected you.
...Come in.
After getting mentally prepared, you push the door open.
You first smell a light fragrance, then see Vanessa sitting straight on her bed.

Vanessa is mostly the same as how you remember her, but with subtle differences. She is dressed in a glamorous gown that looks out of place and wearing near flawless makeup. You notice her delicate eyelashes and a complicated but beautiful laced eye mask on her left eye.
Still, you can see the horrifying scars under the mask if you look carefully.
What are you looking at? Are you tired of your own eye too?
She sounds as sarcastic as always.

Params[2]: You seem to be... in good spirits.
Params[4]: I think I know why you kept me waiting for an hour.

Params[3]: That has nothing to do with you though.
Definitely not for you.
Vanessa throws back a sarcastic remark without mercy.
You are an idiot who couldn't even protect yourself. Even your Constructs were eager to throw their lives away. If not for me, you wouldn't be able to stand here.
Do you even know how messed up you looked when you lay on a junk bed in the basement? Do you know how much hassle you caused?
Her words sound more aggressive than ever, as if you have triggered something.

Params[2]: (Feels like she is just taking it out on me...)

Params[3]: Weren't you going to push the door in? Why aren't you talking now?
Vanessa seems in a good mood as she begins to smile. She elegantly reaches out for water on the table in front.
—But she fails to pick up the white porcelain cup. Her hand, wrapped in bandage, just moves past the cup and misses it.
She pulls the hand back out of instinct, splashing water that soaks the bandage on her purlicue.
...Forget about it. It's already cold.
She quickly conceals it, but you still see a moment of frailty in her eyes.
You grab the cup and pour her another cup of warm water, then pass it to her hand.
Vanessa gives you a peculiar look. She has not rejected your offer—which is quite unusual—and holds the cup with both hands.
Hah... Gray Raven Commandant being so submissive and obedient to me? This is definitely a new experience. I'm not used to this.
She looks at her reflection in the cup and turns silent.
After what seems like an eternity, the silence is interrupted by door-knocking sounds.
With a large bag in his hand, Simon peeks into the ward, followed by Bambinata.
Master, I met Commandant Simon on the way. He said he wanted to visit you.
How are you feeling, Vanessa? Oh, Chief, you're here too!
You wave at Simon. He looks a little shocked when seeing Vanessa on the bed.
Um, you—
What's going on today? Are all the losers having a reunion?
Vanessa interrupts Simon before he can finish.
Simon completely ignores Vanessa's sarcasm. He gently places the bag on the cabinet next to her bed.
You should increase your vitamin intake. Recovering from major injuries can be quite challenging. When I was...
I don't—
Bambinata would like to thank Commandant Simon on Master's behalf.
Bambinata has been standing aside quietly. She suddenly walks up and takes Simon's bag.
Master would need this. The doctor had said so.
You all...
Meanwhile, Simon has already begun to dig into the bag, taking out one item after another while explaining them to Vanessa.
There are nutritious foods, books for killing time during rehab, gifts from the survivors of the evacuation, and many other things.
Vanessa still maintains her indifferent attitude, with occasional sarcastic comments. Still, she "reluctantly" makes Bambinata carefully put away the things Simon brought.
Another new visitor has shown up in the room.
Wow, this place is so busy! I didn't expect all of you to be here.
Don't you have anything more important to do...?
We're on it right now. Nothing is more important than visiting my heroic senior.
Harley Jo looks so genuine that Vanessa cannot get mad at him.
...Whatever.
She takes a sip from the cup in her hand, covering her face with it.

The four of you sit together, enjoying a rare moment of tranquility while reminiscing about the past in F.O.S. Since graduation, you have never had such a relaxing time to interact with your classmates even during official school reunions.
Maybe the next time you can meet somewhere else other than Star of Life.
You bump into Bianca when you leave Star of Life.
You nod to her. She smiles and nods in return.
Commandant.
You both continue to walk your own ways. A few Constructs quickly run past, calling her name.
Captain Bianca!
Bianca's elegant but determined steps come to a halt. She pauses ahead, as if waiting for her members.
You cannot help but stop walking and glance back, catching a glimpse of Bianca's smiling profile as she turns toward them.

The Purifying Force you remember is always serious and distant. They do not want emotions to hinder their actions, for they know that one day they may have to turn their blades against their former comrades.
I guess we will witness many more losses and farewells like this one in the future.
But right now, they can stand together and walk forward like this.
Something is changing, quietly but surely, just like burning flames.
One day, all the encounters and separations will turn into a spark to light up the silent sea and guide the way to hope.
